column1: Aleysk (Russian: Але́йск) is a town in Altai Krai
column3: located on the Aley River (Ob's tributary)
column4: 120 kilometers (75 mi) southwest of Barnaul. Population: 29

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Aleysk serves as the administrative center of Aleysky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of krai significance of Aleysk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of krai significance of Aleysk is incorporated as Aleysk Urban Okrug.

column1: The town was host to Aleysk air base
column2: and a division of the Strategic Rocket Forces
column3: the 41st Guards Rocket Division. A brigade of the Central Military District is now located in Aleysk.

column1: Алтайский краевой Совет народных депутатов. Закон №28-ЗС от 1 марта 2008 г. «Об административно-территориальном устройстве Алтайского края»
